FuncDef:
The filter-policy export command configures IS-IS to filter the imported routes to be advertised.
The undo filter-policy export command disables IS-IS from filtering the routes to be advertised. The filter-policy export command configures IS-IS to filter the imported routes to be advertised. The undo filter-policy export command disables IS-IS from filtering the routes to be advertised. By default, IS-IS does not filter the routes to be advertised.
CLIs: filter-policy { <acl-number> | acl-name <acl-name-string> | ip-prefix <ip-prefix-name> | route-policy <route-policy-name> } { export [ direct | static | rip <process-id> | bgp | ospf <process-id> | isis <process-id> ] }

undo filter-policy [ <acl-number> | acl-name <acl-name-string> | ip-prefix <ip-prefix-name> | route-policy <route-policy-name> ] { export [ direct | static | rip <process-id> | bgp | ospf <process-id> | isis <process-id> ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a basic ACL number.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a named basic ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Specifies the name of an IP prefix list.
The name is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the name of a route-policy to filter routes based on tags and other protocol parameters.
The name is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies to filter the imported direct routes before route advertisement.
-

Specifies to filter the imported static routes before route advertisement.
-

Specifies to filter the imported RIP routes before route advertisement.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies to filter the imported BGP routes before route advertisement.
-

Specifies to filter the imported OSPF routes before route advertisement.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies to filter the imported IS-IS routes before route advertisement.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
When IS-IS and other routing protocols are running on the network, and a boundary router in the IS-IS domain has imported routes of other routing protocols, the boundary router will advertise all the imported routes to its IS-IS neighbors by default.
When the routes that meet certain conditions need to be advertised, you can run the filter-policy export command to configure filtering rules. In this manner, only the routes that meet the filtering rules can be advertised.
